result.title: Enhanced CIARD RING with CAPSELLA data sets & global map of challenges & ideas for solutions 2
result.description: This software deliverable will be the deployment of the online catalogues of challenges, needed data sources, and ideas/prototypes of solutions. It will include mechanisms for community-driven population with local challenges & solutions, as well as voting mechanisms for selecting the most important and popular ones. It will be deployed in three iterations/versions

result.title: Black Sea Marine Innovation Report
result.description: This deliverable will present the report Innovation for Blue Economy for the Black Sea to be produced as a part of Task 34A critical action of this task will be that stakeholders from science and research policymaking industry business and investment will be brought together at a thematic workshop or conference on innovation for sustainability and economic growth in the Black Sea to enhance communication and collaboration In link with WP4 a contest on marine innovation will be organized to further support development of novel ideas and application to the Black Sea region This event will lead to an innovation report and will support the Implementation Plan development

result.title: Practice abstracts from the second reporting period
result.description: "Set of 10 practice abstracts in the EIP Agri format from the second reporting period. These will include abstracts on: a) types of demonstration activity, b) learning through demonstration, the c) role of demonstration in innovation; best practice in enabling virtual demonstration farms; best practice in on-farm demonstration; policy recommendations for supporting on-farm demonstration. These will be produced in English and selected national languages. A ""practice abstract"" is a short summary of around 1000-1500 characters (word count – no spaces) which describes a main information/recommendation/practice that can serve the end-users in their daily practice. Abstracts will follow the EIP-AGRI guidance available on the web-site."
